June 17, 2007: Fiction
A THOUSAND SPLENDID SUNS, by Khaled Hosseini. (Riverhead, $25.95.) A
friendship between two women in Afghanistan against the backdrop of 30 years of
war; from the author of “The Kite Runner.”
THE OVERLOOK, by Michael Connelly. (Little, Brown, $21.99.) The Los Angeles
detective Harry Bosch tangles with the F.B.I. and Homeland Security as he tries to
solve the case of a murdered physicist with access to radioactive materials.
THE GOOD GUY, by Dean Koontz. (Bantam, $27.) In a case of mistaken identity,
an ordinary man finds himself at the center of a murder plot.
FOR ONE MORE DAY, by Mitch Albom. (Hyperion, $21.95.) A troubled man gets
a last chance to reconnect and restore his relationship with his dead mother.
THE 6TH TARGET, by James Patterson and Maxine Paetro. (Little, Brown,
$27.99.) In San Francisco, children are disappearing, and Detective Lindsay Boxer
and the Women’s Murder Club investigate.
INVISIBLE PREY, by John Sandford. (Putnam, $26.95.) The Minneapolis
detective Lucas Davenport finds connections between the murder of several
elderly residents and a political scandal.
THE CHILDREN OF HÚRIN, by J. R. R. Tolkien. Edited by Christopher Tolkien.
Illustrated by Alan Lee. (Houghton Mifflin, $26.) In Middle-earth, an evil lord wants
to destroy his rival’s children.
SACRIFICE, by Karen Traviss. (Del Rey/Ballantine, $25.95.) Jacen, the son of
Han and Leia Solo, must murder someone close to him to become a Sith lord; a
“Star Wars” novel.
BAD LUCK AND TROUBLE, by Lee Child. (Delacorte, $26.) Jack Reacher must
discover who is hunting down members of a team of former military investigators.
THE YIDDISH POLICEMEN’S UNION, by Michael Chabon. (HarperCollins,
$26.95.) A detective investigates a neighbor’s murder in a Jewish settlement in
Alaska.
SIMPLE GENIUS, by David Baldacci. (Warner, $26.99.) Two former Secret
Service agents investigate a scientist’s murder while one battles her own demons.
NINETEEN MINUTES, by Jodi Picoult. (Atria, $26.95.) The aftermath of a high
school shooting reveals the fault lines in a small New Hampshire town.
RANT, by Chuck Palahniuk. (Doubleday, $24.95.) The “oral biography” of a serial
killer.

Non-Fiction
THE ASSAULT ON REASON, by Al Gore. (Penguin Press, $25.95.) How the Bush
administration has degraded the political environment through secrecy, fear and
the rejection of fact-based reasoning.
THE REAGAN DIARIES, by Ronald Reagan. Edited by Douglas Brinkley.
(HarperCollins, $35.) Selections from the 40th president’s daily White House
diaries.
GOD IS NOT GREAT, by Christopher Hitchens. (Twelve, $24.99.) Religion as a
malignant force in the world.
EINSTEIN, by Walter Isaacson. (Simon & Schuster, $32.) A biography based on
newly released personal letters.
A LONG WAY GONE, by Ishmael Beah. (Sarah Crichton/Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$22.) A former child soldier from Sierra Leone describes his drug-crazed killing
spree and his return to humanity.
ANIMAL, VEGETABLE, MIRACLE, by Barbara Kingsolver with Steven L. Hopp
and Camille Kingsolver. (HarperCollins, $26.95.) The novelist and her family
spend a year eating homegrown or local food; an argument for sustainable
agriculture.
PRESIDENTIAL COURAGE, by Michael Beschloss. (Simon & Schuster, $28.)
Profiles of nine presidents who had the courage to make unpopular decisions.
JESUS OF NAZARETH, by Benedict XVI. (Doubleday, $24.95.) The pope
discusses Jesus’ identity as revealed in the Gospels.
WHERE HAVE ALL THE LEADERS GONE?, by Lee Iacocca. (Scribner, $25.) The
former C.E.O. of Chrysler protests the lack of political and business leadership on
issues like health care and energy policy.
RICKLES’ BOOK, by Don Rickles with David Ritz. (Simon & Schuster, $24.) A
memoir by the insult comedian.
THE BLACK SWAN, by Nassim Nicholas Taleb. (Random House, $26.95.) The
role of the unexpected.
THE CANON, by Natalie Angier. (Houghton Mifflin, $27.) A refresher course on
the fundamentals of science.
BROTHERS, by David Talbot. (Free Press, $28.) An assessment of John F.
Kennedy’s administration and a plea for a new effort to uncover the truth about his
assassination.
